author: kevaundray
content: Thank you ser, skimmed it and just need to think about the naming convention, I was using capital letters to denote commitments and ignoring clippy. Though maybe it‚Äôs better to use lowercase and rely on the user using rust-analyser which shows the types

author: controlcthenv
content: I figured it was for mathematical notation to denote specific variables. I fixed it just because I was fixing clippy stuff in a spree, but I don‚Äôt have a preference either way, and can swap in back capital letters + clippy ignores on them if you want

author: controlcthenv
content: I did mean to ask you about some of the unused code which is blocking clippy CI being added back, is that leftover from previous versions or needed for future additions?

author: kevaundray
content: You mean like the fuzzer code?

author: controlcthenv
content: Some structs have unread fields, and some variables are unused

author: controlcthenv
content: I‚Äôm working on adding fuzzer + benchmarks back in so I can add in async

author: kevaundray
content:
Ah I think some of those are from fields being used in tests only.

One thing I think that we can get rid of is ‚Äòverkle_db‚Äô it was meant to be used so that consumers could provide a key value db and then all of the necessary verkle method would be automatically implemented, but I think that clients will probably need to do this themselves based on their internal infrastructure

author: kevaundray
content: <@834543635587924028> saw your PR, I like the structure. Maybe I‚Äôm misreading it, are you suggesting to add ‚ÄúTopological Sorting‚Äù as a concrete item or was it an example for algorithms?

author: controlcthenv
content: Ok, do you mind if I break out tests into `/tests` folder as well, and delete `main.rs` (since rust-verkle is a lib)?

author: kevaundray
content: Yeah main.rs can be removed. I‚Äôd prefer to keep unit tests in the same module and put integration tests in /tests

author: controlcthenv
content: Ok, then this would just be `trie_fuzzer` going into `/tests` then correct?

author: controlcthenv
content: Ok, I can quickly add these to my PR shortly

author: controlcthenv
content: Glad to help, changes are on my PR now. I can do whatever you want on the `C_1` vs `c_1` thing as well btw

author: kevaundray
content:
LGTM, we can use c_1 as in your PR.


 I think changes to those variable names might need to be first done at a higher level in docs, then propagated to implementations, so out of scope for this PR
